best.why: It nails the manifesto’s intellectual spine: the precise historical diagnosis, the new scarcity (judgment), and the direct declaration of what Slopism *is*. The others are poetic; this one is foundational.

worst.why: It’s a single defiant shrug. A manifesto opening needs to seduce, define, and arm the reader. This just says “no” and walks away.

must_survive_line: The cost of making has collapsed to zero. The cost of choosing well has not. It has never been higher.
